ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.2_0: On one occasion when the monks from the group of six were making robes, they asked for a large amount of thread.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.3_0: Once again there was much thread left over.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.5_0: “Well, let’s ask for more thread and have weavers weave us robe-cloth.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.6_0: Soon afterwards the monks from the group of six asked for more thread and then have weavers weave them robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.7_0: Yet even when the robe-cloth had been woven, there was much thread left over.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.8_0: A second time they asked for more thread and had weavers weave them robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.9_0: Yet even when the robe-cloth had been woven, there was much thread left over.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.10_0: A third time they asked for more thread and had weavers weave them robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.11_0: People complained and criticized the monks,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.12_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics ask for thread and then have weavers weave them robe-cloth?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.13_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.14_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.15_0: “How can the monks from the group of six ask for thread and then have weavers weave them robe-cloth?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.16_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.17_0: “Is it true, monks, that you did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.20_0: “... Foolish men, how can you ask for thread and then have weavers weave you robe-cloth?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.21_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.22_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:1.23.1_0: ‘If a monk himself asks for thread, and then has weavers weave him robe-cloth, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.4_0: ...The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.8_0: there are six kinds of yarn:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.9_0: linen, cotton, silk, wool, sunn hemp, and hemp.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.11_0: If he has it woven by weavers, then for every effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.12_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.13_0: The blanket should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.14_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.16_0: ‘Venerables, this robe-cloth which I had weavers weave after asking for the thread myself is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.17_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.20_0: ‘I give this robe-cloth back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.21.1_0: If he had it woven, and he perceives that he did, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.22_0: If he had it woven, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.23_0: If he had it woven, but he does not perceive that he did, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.24_0: If he did not have it woven, but he perceives that he did, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.25_0: If he did not have it woven, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.26_0: If he did not have it woven, and he does not perceive that he did, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.27.1_0: there is no offense for him.

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.30_0: if it is for a belt;

ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np26:2.40_0: The sixth rule, the training rule on asking non-relations, is finished.
